extraction_metadata.focus: Additional Johnson-Renfro connections: Timothy Johnson (Orange Co), Eleanor Renfro & John Johnson (Montgomery Co), Absalom Looney line, and the Dickson County TN Johnson-Renfro network (Hudson Johnson, Nathaniel Johnson, Peter Renfro)
extraction_metadata.notes: This batch captures several distinct Johnson-Renfro connection points across time and geography, plus the Absalom Looney line which is a separate branch from Benjamin Looney.

sources_to_add.full_citation: Virginia Land Office Patents, Brunswick County, 30 July 1742, p. 41.
Lunenburg County, Virginia, List of Tithables, 1750, from Falling Creek to Goose River.
Dickson County, Tennessee, Deed Book A, p. 271. Deed from Nathaniel Johnson to Peter Renfro, 26 November 1808.
Montgomery County, Virginia, Marriage Records, various dates.
War Department, Pension Office, Washington D.C., Record #709844, dated 7 January 1903. Absalom David Looney service record.

documents.title: Orange County Delinquent List 1738 - Timothy Johnson and James Johnson
documents.transcription_excerpt: Timothy Johnson James Johnson ....... 4. Timothy Johnson left with the Renfro Families from Orange Co Va see above 1738 Deliquet list of Orange Co

people.notes: Listed with 4 tithables along with James Johnson. Tony notes: 'Timothy Johnson left with the Renfro Families from Orange Co Va'

documents.notes: KEY DOCUMENT: Timothy Johnson appears on the 1738 Orange County delinquent list with 4 tithables. Tony explicitly states he 'left with the Renfro Families from Orange Co Va.' This connects a Johnson to the Renfro migration pattern.

documents.title: Timothy Johnson Patent - 200 acres on North Side of Otter River
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1742 July 30: Brunswick County: Timothy Johnson: 200 acres on the North Side of Otter River above the Mouth of Flatt Creek: Library of Virginia Archives Section. RESEARCH NOTES: 1742 July 30 (Brunswick CO. VA) Timothy Johnson, 200 acres on the N. Side of Otter River above the mouth of Flatt Cr. for 1 pound, page 41.

locations.name: Flatt Creek
locations.description: Above the mouth of Flatt Creek

documents.notes: Timothy Johnson patented land in Brunswick County 1742. This land was later acquired by John Payne in 1756. Tony notes connection to Bedford County where David Johnson, John Johnson, and Timothy Johnson had wills probated.

documents.title: Lunenburg County Tithables 1750 - Timothy Johnson and James Johnson
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1750 List of Lunenburg Tithes From Falling Creek to Goose River Taken by John Phelps are Timothy Johnson Jas. Johnson pd by Jos. Rust 4 tithes

people.notes: Paid tithes for Timothy and James Johnson - 4 tithes total

documents.notes: Timothy and James Johnson appear together again in 1750, now in Lunenburg County (which was formed from Brunswick). Their tithes were paid by Joseph Rust.

documents.title: Nathaniel Johnson to Peter Renfro - 320 acres on Bartons Creek
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1808 Nov. 26th of Deed from Nathaniel Johnson to Peter Renfro, both of Dickson Co. $100. tract of land containing 320 acres lying on the south side of the Cumberland River on the waters of Bartons Creek, being part of a tract granted to John Gray Blount and Thomas Blount assignees of Christopher Darker's heirs. Test: Jessee Brown, James Sims (X), John Johnston Deed Book A page 271

people.notes: Dickson County TN; connected to Hudson Johnson per Tony's research notes
Dickson County TN; connected to Hudson Johnson family
Tony identifies as son of Hudson Johnson

locations.name: Bartons Creek
locations.notes: South side of Cumberland River. Hudson Johnson also lived on Bartons Creek.

documents.notes: KEY DOCUMENT: Shows Nathaniel Johnson selling land to Peter Renfro in Dickson County TN. Tony's research notes state: 'Hudson Johnson lived on Bartons Creek with wife Agness. Hudson Johnson died in 1823 Dickson Co Tn his son is John Johnston and daughter is Mary Johnston Shropshire.' This connects to Tony's direct ancestry.

documents.title: John Johnson and Eleanor Renfro Marriage - Montgomery County VA
documents.transcription_excerpt: 1775 Eleanor Renfro was born and died in 1833. She married John Johnson bef 1793 Montgomery CO Va. Reported Children of Eleanor Renfro and John Johnson: John Johnson Jr, Clarissa Johnson, Roswell Johnson, Eleanor Johnson, William R. Johnson b 1793 Montgomery Co Va.
documents.notes: Another Johnson-Renfro marriage connection. Children later moved to Ripley County, Indiana.

documents.title: Absalom David Looney War of 1812 Service Record
documents.transcription_excerpt: ABSALOM DAVID LOONEY, son of MICHAEL LOONEY and TEMPERANCE CROSS LOONEY: Served War of 1812, as private in Captain George Argenbright's Company, Regiment 2, from October 2, 1813, to February 8, 1814... During the War of 1812 Absalom David Looney Volunteered in Hawkins County, on 2 October 1813 for 3 months and was mustered in at Knoxville, Tennessee, as a private in Captain George Argenbright's Company, 4th Regiment of E. Tennessee Volunteer Riflemen, under Colonel William Lillard and served 4 months, 6 days against the Creek Indians. He was discharged at Rogersville.
documents.notes: War of 1812 service record for Absalom David Looney. He received bounty land warrants totaling 160 acres.

family_groups_to_create.name: Absalom Looney of Botetourt/Hawkins
family_groups_to_create.primary_location: Augusta County, Virginia; Botetourt County; Hawkins County, Tennessee
family_groups_to_create.summary: Absalom Looney (1729-1791) was a separate Looney line from Robert Looney Jr.'s line. Born possibly in Ireland, married Eleanor Margaret Moore/Rowland 1750 in Augusta County. Son Michael Looney (1758-1827) moved to Hawkins County TN, purchased Stanley Valley land from Mr. Stanley for a long knife and spotted horse (1780). Grandson Absalom David Looney (1790-1862) served in War of 1812, married Sarah Jane Starnes, had 12 children.
family_groups_to_create.notes: This is a DIFFERENT Looney line from Benjamin Looney who married Mary Johnson. The exact relationship between Absalom Looney and Robert Looney Sr./Jr. is not documented in this file.

family_groups_to_create.name: John Johnson and Eleanor Renfro of Montgomery County
family_groups_to_create.primary_location: Montgomery County, Virginia; Ripley County, Indiana
family_groups_to_create.summary: John Johnson married Eleanor Renfro before 1793 in Montgomery County VA. Had children: John Jr., Clarissa, Roswell, Eleanor, William R. (b.1793). Some descendants moved to Ripley County, Indiana.

family_groups_to_create.name: Hudson Johnson of Bartons Creek, Dickson County
family_groups_to_create.dna_connection: Hudson Johnson is Tony L. Johnson's direct ancestor and a confirmed White Oak descendant
family_groups_to_create.summary: Hudson Johnson lived on Bartons Creek, Dickson County TN with wife Agness. Died 1823. Son John Johnston witnessed the 1808 Nathaniel Johnson to Peter Renfro deed. Daughter Mary Johnston married Joel Shropshire. Connected to Nathaniel Johnson who sold land to Peter Renfro. This is Tony L. Johnson's direct ancestral line.

Moved from Dickson to Maury Co

new_people_to_create.evidence: 1808 Dickson Co deed; census records 1820-1840 Wayne Co TN
new_people_to_create.notes: Married Jane McClish (widow of William McClish). Connected to Hudson Johnson family on Bartons Creek. Moved: Dickson Co → Maury Co → Wayne Co TN. Born 1760-1770 per 1840 census. No children listed on any census.

new_people_to_create.evidence: Married Eleanor Renfro before 1793 Montgomery Co VA
new_people_to_create.notes: Married Eleanor Renfro (b.1775, d.1833). Children: John Jr., Clarissa, Roswell, Eleanor, William R. (b.1793). Some descendants moved to Ripley Co IN.

new_people_to_create.evidence: Born 1775, died 1833; married John Johnson before 1793 Montgomery Co VA
new_people_to_create.notes: Married John Johnson. Children moved to Ripley County, Indiana.

new_people_to_create.evidence: Family records; died 28 Sep 1791 Botetourt Co VA
new_people_to_create.notes: SEPARATE LINE from Robert Looney Jr. Married Eleanor Margaret Moore/Rowland 1750. Father of Michael Looney who settled Stanley Valley, Hawkins Co TN.
Wife of Absalom Looney. Also listed as 'Margaret Eleanor Rowland (Moore)'. Died before husband per one source, but other source says died 1799.

locations.evidence: Purchased land from Mr. Stanley 1780 for long knife and spotted horse; deeded to son 1829

new_people_to_create.notes: Son of Absalom Looney. Married Temperance Cross (b.c.1752 Ireland). Purchased Stanley Valley land 1780 - gave long knife and spotted horse for it. Built log house that became homestead. Father of Absalom David Looney.
Wife of Michael Looney. Born Ireland c.1752. Died Hawkins Co TN.

locations.evidence: Discharged from War of 1812 service at Rogersville

new_people_to_create.evidence: War of 1812 pension records; tombstone; family Bible
new_people_to_create.notes: Son of Michael Looney and Temperance Cross. War of 1812 veteran (served against Creek Indians). Married Sarah Jane Starnes 1819. Had 12 children. Presbyterian. 'Sturdy build, average height, blond complexion.' Successful farmer, gave each child inheritance of land and slaves.

locations_to_create.name: Otter River
locations_to_create.description: River in Brunswick County where Timothy Johnson patented 200 acres in 1742.
locations_to_create.notes: Flatt Creek is near the mouth. Area later became part of Bedford County.

locations_to_create.name: Flatt Creek
locations_to_create.description: Creek near Otter River. Timothy Johnson's 1742 patent was 'above the mouth of Flatt Creek.'

locations_to_create.name: Bartons Creek
locations_to_create.description: Creek on south side of Cumberland River. Hudson Johnson lived here with wife Agness. Nathaniel Johnson sold 320 acres here to Peter Renfro 1808.
locations_to_create.notes: Key location for Tony L. Johnson's direct ancestry

locations_to_create.name: Hickory Cove
locations_to_create.description: Location of Absalom David Looney's second home and burial place. Later known as 'Pearson Place' and 'Pearson Cemetery.'

locations_to_create.name: Rogersville
locations_to_create.description: County seat of Hawkins County. Absalom David Looney discharged from War of 1812 here. Stanley Valley about 7 miles east.

locations_to_create.name: Lee Valley
locations_to_create.description: Valley north of Clinch Mountain. Home of John Starnes family (in-laws of Absalom David Looney).

locations_to_create.name: Wayne County
locations_to_create.description: Tennessee county where Peter Renfro lived 1817-1840s after leaving Dickson County.

research_questions_to_add.question: Is Timothy Johnson of Orange County related to Michael Johnson of Tuckahoe Creek?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Both in Virginia; Timothy traveled with Renfro families who later intermarried with Looneys connected to Michael Johnson's area
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Compare locations and dates; check if Orange County Johnsons overlap with Henrico County Johnsons

research_questions_to_add.question: What is the relationship between Absalom Looney (1729-1791) and Robert Looney Jr. (1721-1770)?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Both in Augusta County area same time period; both Looney surname
research_questions_to_add.evidence_against: No documented connection in this file; Absalom possibly from Ireland
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Research Looney family origins; check if both descend from Robert Looney Sr.

research_questions_to_add.question: How is Hudson Johnson connected to the White Oak / Michael Johnson line?
research_questions_to_add.evidence_for: Tony states Hudson Johnson is 'a known White Oak Descendant'; Tony descends from Hudson
research_questions_to_add.evidence_against: Specific lineage not documented in this file
research_questions_to_add.research_action: Document the generational chain from Michael Johnson (d.1718) to Hudson Johnson (d.1823)

key_findings: TIMOTHY JOHNSON 'left with the Renfro Families from Orange Co Va' (1738) - direct Johnson-Renfro connection
Timothy Johnson and James Johnson listed together on 1738 Orange Co delinquent list and 1750 Lunenburg tithables
HUDSON JOHNSON (d.1823) of Bartons Creek, Dickson Co TN - Tony's direct ancestor and confirmed White Oak descendant
John Johnston (son of Hudson) witnessed 1808 deed from Nathaniel Johnson to Peter Renfro
Nathaniel Johnson sold 320 acres on Bartons Creek to Peter Renfro 1808 - Johnson-Renfro land connection
John Johnson married Eleanor Renfro in Montgomery Co VA before 1793 - another Johnson-Renfro marriage
Absalom Looney (1729-1791) is a SEPARATE Looney line from Robert Looney Jr.
Michael Looney purchased Stanley Valley land 1780 for 'a long knife and spotted horse'
Absalom David Looney served War of 1812, had 12 children, buried at Hickory Cove
